com.markussecundus.forms.elements.impl.layouts

Class BasicLinearLayout<Rend,Pos,Scalar extends java.lang.Comparable<Scalar>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.markussecundus.forms.elements.impl.BasicAbstractDrawable<Rend,Pos,Scalar>
      • com.markussecundus.forms.elements.impl.layouts.BasicAbstractLayout<Rend,Pos,Scalar>
        • com.markussecundus.forms.elements.impl.layouts.BasicLinearLayout<Rend,Pos,Scalar>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable<Rend,Pos>, Element, UberDrawable<Rend,Pos>, UberElement

    public class BasicLinearLayout<Rend,Pos,Scalar extends java.lang.Comparable<Scalar>>
extends BasicAbstractLayout<Rend,Pos,Scalar>
    Basic layout for arranging Elements in line.
    Author:
    MarkusSecundus
    See Also:
    BasicAbstractLayout

      the rightmost layout allignment that makes sense
      Property<java.lang.Boolean> ignoreTooShort
      Decides whether the BasicLinearLayout.LayoutTooShortException is thrown at the end of child positions recompute if the children don't fit into the layout, or if it is ignored.

      • ignoreTooShort

        public final Property<java.lang.Boolean> ignoreTooShort
        Decides whether the BasicLinearLayout.LayoutTooShortException is thrown at the end of child positions recompute if the children don't fit into the layout, or if it is ignored.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicLinearLayout

        public BasicLinearLayout(Pos prefSize,
                         VectUtil<Pos,Scalar> posUtil)
        Inits the layout with default values. maxSize: vectUtil.MAX_VALUE() minSize: vectUtil.ZERO() outerPadding: vectUtil.ZERO() innerPadding: vectUtil.ZERO_SCALAR() dimension: 0 allignments: [0,0,...,0]
        Parameters:
        prefSize - default value for layout's preffered size
        posUtil - VectUtil for the used vector type

      • BasicLinearLayout

        public BasicLinearLayout(Pos maxSize,
                         Pos minSize,
                         Pos prefSize,
                         VectUtil<Pos,Scalar> posUtil,
                         Pos outerPadding,
                         Scalar innerPadding,
                         int dimension,
                         java.lang.Double[] allignments)
        Inits the layout with default values.
        Parameters:
        maxSize - initial value for layout's max size
        minSize - initial value for layout's min size
        prefSize - initial value for layout's preffered size
        posUtil - VectUtil for the used vector type
        outerPadding - initial value for both of layout's outer paddings
        innerPadding - initial value for layout's inner paddings
        dimension - initial value for the dimension in which the linearity is applied
        allignments - initial values for allignments of children elements; must be values of interval [0d, 1d]

      • childPosition

        public ReadonlyProperty<Pos> childPosition(Drawable<Rend,Pos> child)
        Returns the position of child relative to the parent (this). Can return null if child isn't really the child of this.
        Specified by:
        childPosition in interface UberDrawable<Rend,Pos>
        Overrides:
        childPosition in class BasicAbstractLayout<Rend,Pos,Scalar extends java.lang.Comparable<Scalar>>
        Parameters:
        child - the child of this whose position is being obtained

      • computeRealSize

        public Pos computeRealSize()
        Returns:
        the ammount of place that the container elements and padding really fill on the screen in the way they are arranged by the layout

      • draw

        public void draw(Rend renderer,
                 Pos position)
        Renders drawable children on their associated positions relative to position parameter. Called each frame, renders the Drawable on the screen.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Drawable<Rend,Pos>
        Overrides:
        draw in class BasicAbstractLayout<Rend,Pos,Scalar extends java.lang.Comparable<Scalar>>
        Parameters:
        renderer - The instance of Rend using which the Drawable is to be rendered
        position - The position on which the Drawable is supposed to be drawn. By convention should define the leftmost-downmost edge of the rectangle circumscribed to the this if in 2D space

      • applySizeChanges

        public void applySizeChanges()
        Checks if child sizes or positions are dirty and optionally recomputes them as when rendering.
